scheme_name: National Centre for Earth Science Studies Internship Scheme
details: The “National Centre for Earth Science Studies Internship” scheme by the Earth System Science Organization, Ministry of Earth Sciences, provides various opportunities for school as well as college students to familiarise and/or pursue research on different branches of earth sciences.
benefits: Opportunities to work on various branches of earth sciences, including geology, oceanography, meteorology, and environmental science.
Hands-on research projects and exposure to advanced scientific methodologies.
Open day for school students in April every year.
Internship/summer training and dissertation programs for university students.
eligibility: School students interested in exploring and conducting research in the field of earth sciences.
College students interested in exploring and conducting research in the field of earth sciences.
application_process: Candidates must apply in the prescribed format available on the NCESS website.
Selected candidates need to bring a printout of their application forms, duly signed by the HOD of their respective department with an official seal, at the time of arrival for training.
documents_required: Printout of application form duly signed by the HOD of the respective department with an official seal
